alert.note: Alert for Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cape May County through 415 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cape May Court House, or 10 miles north of Cape May, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Wildwood, Wildwood Crest, Sea Isle City, Avalon, Stone Harbor, Cape May Court House, Scotch Bonnet, Green Creek, Goshen, Rio Grande, Villas, West Wildwood, Whitesboro-Burleigh and Erma. People at the Barefoot Country Music Fest should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 4 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May
